  • Low-Level API
    • Prerequisites
    • 1. Ingest a Dataset
      • Object Relational Model (ORM)
      • a) Registering Datasets
        • Dataset.Tabular
        • Dataset.Sequence
        • Dataset.Image
      • b) Reading Datasets into Memory
        • Dataset.Tabular
        • Dataset.Sequence
        • Dataset.Image
    • 2. Selecting Features and Labels.
      • a) Select the Label column(s).
        • ORM
        • Deriving Labels
        • Reading Labels
      • b) Select the Feature column(s).
        • ORM
        • Specifying Features
        • Reading Features
    • 3. Slicing samples.
      • a) Define sliding time series Windows.
        • ORM
        • Specifying Windows
        • Reading Windows
      • b) Slice samples with a Splitset.
        • Stratification
        • Splitting Strategies
        • Reading Splitsets
      • c) Create a Foldset for cross-validation.
        • ORM
        • Fold objects
        • Specifying Foldsets
        • Reading Foldsets
    • 4. Preprocessing - Interpolation.
      • ORM
      • a) Interpolate Labels with Labelpolater.
      • b) Interpolate Features with Interpolaterset.
    • 5. Preprocessing - Encoding.
      • Encoding
      • a) Encode labels with Labelcoder.
        • Creating a Labelcoder
      • b) Encode Features sequentially with Ensoderset.
        • Filtering feature columns
    • 6. Preprocessing - Reshaping.
      • ORM
      • Reshaping by Index
      • Reshaping Explicitly
      • Multiplicative Reshaping
    • 7. Defining Architectures & Hyperparameters.
      • a) Define an Algorithm
        • Model Definition
        • Group the functions together in an Algorithm!
      • b) Combinations of hyperparameters with Hyperparamset.
        • Hyperparameter Selection Strategies.
        • Hyperparamcombo objects.
    • 8. Queue of training Jobs.
      • a) Job objects.
      • b) Executing Jobs.
        • i) queue.run_jobs()
        • ii) DEPRECATED - queue.run_jobs(in_background=True).
        • iii) Future, cluster execution.
      • c) Predictors are the trained models.
        • Fetching the trained model.
      • d) Predictions are the output of a Predictor.
        • Fetching metrics.
    • 9. Metrics & Visualization
  • Inference
    • Predictor
    • New Splitset
    • Run Inference

About

  • Mission
    • Why Does AIQC Exist?
      • 1. Accelerate science by making deep learning accessible.
      • 2. Bring the scientific method to data science.
      • 3. Break down walled gardens to keep science open.

Keras: Classify Binary¶

Reference this great blog for machine learning cookbooks: MachineLearningMastery.com “Binary Classification”.

[2]:

import keras
from keras.models import Sequential
from keras.layers import Dense, Dropout
from keras.callbacks import History

from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelBinarizer, PowerTransformer

import aiqc
from aiqc import datum

Example Data¶

Reference Example Datasets for more information.

[3]:

df = datum.to_pandas('sonar.csv')

[4]:

df.head()

a) High-Level API¶

Reference High-Level API Docs for more information including how to work with non-tabular data.

[5]:

splitset = aiqc.Pipeline.Tabular.make(
    df_or_path = df
    , dtype = None

    , feature_cols_excluded = 'object'
    , feature_interpolaters = None
    , feature_window = None
    , feature_encoders = dict(
        sklearn_preprocess = PowerTransformer(method='yeo-johnson', copy=False)
        , dtypes = ['float64']
    )
    , feature_reshape_indices = None

    , label_column = 'object'
    , label_interpolater = None
    , label_encoder = dict(sklearn_preprocess = LabelBinarizer(sparse_output=False))

    , size_test = 0.12
    , size_validation = 0.22
    , fold_count = None
    , bin_count = None
)


___/ featurecoder_index: 0 \_________

=> The column(s) below matched your filter(s) featurecoder filters.

['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f', 'g', 'h', 'i', 'j', 'k', 'l', 'm', 'n', 'o', 'p', 'q', 'r', 's', 't', 'u', 'v', 'w', 'x', 'y', 'z', 'aa', 'ab', 'ac', 'ad', 'ae', 'af', 'ag', 'ah', 'ai', 'aj', 'ak', 'al', 'am', 'an', 'ao', 'ap', 'aq', 'ar', 'as', 'at', 'au', 'av', 'aw', 'ax', 'ay', 'az', 'ba', 'bb', 'bc', 'bd', 'be', 'bf', 'bg', 'bh']

=> Done. All feature column(s) have featurecoder(s) associated with them.
No more Featurecoders can be added to this Encoderset.


[6]:

def fn_build(features_shape, label_shape, **hp):
    model = Sequential(name='Sonar')
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dropout(0.30))
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dropout(0.30))
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dense(units=label_shape[0], activation='sigmoid', kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform'))
    return model

[7]:

def fn_train(model, loser, optimizer, samples_train, samples_evaluate, **hp):
    model.compile(
        loss=loser
        , optimizer=optimizer
        , metrics=['accuracy']
    )
    model.fit(
        samples_train['features'], samples_train['labels']
        , validation_data = (samples_evaluate['features'], samples_evaluate['labels'])
        , verbose = 0
        , batch_size = 3
        , epochs = hp['epochs']
        , callbacks = [History()]
    )
    return model

[8]:

hyperparameters = {
    "neuron_count": [25, 50]
    , "epochs": [75, 150]
}

[9]:

queue = aiqc.Experiment.make(
    library = "keras"
    , analysis_type = "classification_binary"
    , fn_build = fn_build
    , fn_train = fn_train
    , splitset_id = splitset.id
    , repeat_count = 2
    , hide_test = False
    , hyperparameters = hyperparameters

    , fn_lose = None #automated
    , fn_optimize = None #automated
    , fn_predict = None #automated
    , foldset_id = None
)

[10]:

queue.run_jobs()

🔮 Training Models 🔮: 100%|██████████████████████████████████████████| 8/8 [01:32<00:00, 11.58s/it]

For more information on visualization of performance metrics, reference the Visualization & Metrics documentation.

b) Low-Level API¶

Reference Low-Level API Docs for more information including how to work with non-tabular data and defining optimizers.

[11]:

dataset = aiqc.Dataset.Tabular.from_pandas(df)

[12]:

label_column = 'object'

[13]:

label = dataset.make_label(columns=[label_column])

[14]:

labelcoder = label.make_labelcoder(sklearn_preprocess = LabelBinarizer(sparse_output=False))

[15]:

feature = dataset.make_feature(exclude_columns=[label_column])

[16]:

encoderset = feature.make_encoderset()

[17]:

featurecoder_0 = encoderset.make_featurecoder(
    sklearn_preprocess = PowerTransformer(method='yeo-johnson', copy=False)
    , dtypes = ['float64']
)


___/ featurecoder_index: 0 \_________

=> The column(s) below matched your filter(s) featurecoder filters.

['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f', 'g', 'h', 'i', 'j', 'k', 'l', 'm', 'n', 'o', 'p', 'q', 'r', 's', 't', 'u', 'v', 'w', 'x', 'y', 'z', 'aa', 'ab', 'ac', 'ad', 'ae', 'af', 'ag', 'ah', 'ai', 'aj', 'ak', 'al', 'am', 'an', 'ao', 'ap', 'aq', 'ar', 'as', 'at', 'au', 'av', 'aw', 'ax', 'ay', 'az', 'ba', 'bb', 'bc', 'bd', 'be', 'bf', 'bg', 'bh']

=> Done. All feature column(s) have featurecoder(s) associated with them.
No more Featurecoders can be added to this Encoderset.


[18]:

splitset = aiqc.Splitset.make(
    feature_ids = [feature.id]
    , label_id = label.id
    , size_test = 0.22
    , size_validation = 0.12
)

[19]:

def fn_build(features_shape, label_shape, **hp):
    model = Sequential(name='Sonar')
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dropout(0.30))
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dropout(0.30))
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dense(units=label_shape[0], activation='sigmoid', kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform'))
    return model

[20]:

def fn_train(model, loser, optimizer, samples_train, samples_evaluate, **hp):
    model.compile(
        loss=loser
        , optimizer=optimizer
        , metrics=['accuracy']
    )
    model.fit(
        samples_train['features'], samples_train['labels']
        , validation_data = (samples_evaluate['features'], samples_evaluate['labels'])
        , verbose = 0
        , batch_size = 3
        , epochs = hp['epochs']
        , callbacks = [History()]
    )
    return model

[21]:

algorithm = aiqc.Algorithm.make(
    library = "keras"
    , analysis_type = "classification_binary"
    , fn_build = fn_build
    , fn_train = fn_train
)

[22]:

hyperparameters = {
    "neuron_count": [25, 50]
    , "epochs": [75, 150]
}

[23]:

hyperparamset = algorithm.make_hyperparamset(
    hyperparameters = hyperparameters
)

[24]:

queue = algorithm.make_queue(
    splitset_id = splitset.id
    , hyperparamset_id = hyperparamset.id
    , repeat_count = 2
)

[25]:

queue.run_jobs()

🔮 Training Models 🔮: 100%|██████████████████████████████████████████| 8/8 [01:08<00:00,  8.53s/it]

For more information on visualization of performance metrics, reference the Visualization & Metrics documentation.
